name: Department of Agriculture
description: The U.S. Department of Agriculture provides leadership on food, agriculture, natural resources, rural infrastructure, nutrition, and related issues based on public policy, the best available science, and effective management.

budget.procurementBudget: Significant procurement across 70+ covered programs in 10 agencies

painPoints.point: Improper payments crisis - $162 billion in FY2024 including $10.5B in SNAP alone
painPoints.source: GAO-24-107307 Priority Open Recommendations & USDA FY2024 Payment Integrity Report

painPoints.point: Legacy IT systems inefficiencies requiring modernization across Farm Service Agency and mission areas
painPoints.source: USDA IT Strategic Plan FY22-FY26 & GAO Priority Recommendations

painPoints.point: Cybersecurity vulnerabilities - risks from unsecure data collection, adversarial foreign access, and potential agroterrorism
painPoints.source: USDA Farm Security and National Security Report & Forest Service FSM 6600 Updates

painPoints.point: Climate change threatening rural infrastructure investments in housing, energy, water utilities, and agriculture
Performance gaps - only 42% of metrics met or exceeded targets in FY2023, 38% unmet
painPoints.source: USDA FY2025 Performance Plan FY2023 Performance Report

painPoints.point: Limited broadband access in rural areas constraining precision agriculture and economic development
painPoints.source: USDA ReConnect Program & Rural Broadband Expansion Initiatives

painPoints.point: IT program performance monitoring gaps within Farm Production and Conservation mission area
painPoints.source: GAO Priority Recommendations - IT Program Efficiency Goals

painPoints.point: Food Safety and Inspection Service adaptation challenges to climate-driven operational changes
painPoints.source: FSIS Strategic Planning & USDA Climate Adaptation Plan

painPoints.point: IT acquisition and management challenges including project delays, budget overruns, and need for improved oversight and mature acquisition practices affecting agricultural and rural development IT systems
painPoints.source: GAO High-Risk List 2025 - Improving IT Acquisitions and Management

strategicPriorities.priority: Rural broadband expansion through ReConnect and Broadband Technical Assistance programs
strategicPriorities.source: USDA ReConnect Program & Bipartisan Infrastructure Law BTA Program
strategicPriorities.funding: $25 million for BTA Program, multi-billion for ReConnect
strategicPriorities.deadline: Round 5 applications closed May 2024, Round 6 TBD

strategicPriorities.priority: IT modernization - Farm Service Agency systems and digital tools for Rural Development
strategicPriorities.source: USDA FY2025 Budget Summary & IT Strategic Plan FY22-FY26
strategicPriorities.funding: $1 million for digital tools and customer feedback

strategicPriorities.priority: Cybersecurity enhancement and Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) compliance
strategicPriorities.source: Forest Service FSM 6600 Chapter 80 Updates June 2025

strategicPriorities.priority: Climate adaptation and resilience for rural infrastructure, agriculture, and food safety operations
Improper payment reduction in SNAP, farm programs, and Coronavirus Food Assistance Program
Acquisition Program Management Office (APMO) establishment and procurement innovation
strategicPriorities.source: USDA Office of Contracting and Procurement FY2025 Initiatives
strategicPriorities.deadline: First Acquisition Program Management Desk Book in development

strategicPriorities.priority: Justice40 Initiative implementation across 70 covered programs for equitable procurement benefits
strategicPriorities.source: USDA FY2025 Budget Summary - Justice40 as of November 2023

Agricultural IT systems and precision agriculture technology
